section.title: Overview
section.p: The NCC platform alarms are the following:

section.title: Local system monitoring alarms
section.p: The following table lists the local system monitoring alarms.
section.note: All “service down” and “service instance down” alarms have been combined with the other “service down” and “service instance down” alarms into their respective “<Service Name> Service is Down” and “<Service Name> Instance is Down” alarms. For example, “TRSCHEDULER service down” and “TRSCHEDULER service instance down” are now described as part of the <Service Name> Service is Down and <Service Name> Instance is Down alarms in this table.

AutoClear is described in the following tables as being "yes" or "no". AutoClear: yes means that the alarm will be cleared immediately after it is raised. AutoClear: no means that the alarm will be cleared once the condition or scenario has recovered from whatever caused the alarm.

The Alarm ID given for each alarm in all of these tables is displayed on NCC for all alarms. When the NokiaEmsMib MIB (See for more information) is used to integrate any NMS, the Alarm ID is not sent in the SNMP trap. However, when the NokiaEnhancedSnmpSolutionSuiteAlarmIrp MIB is used to integrate any NMS, the Alarm ID is sent in the SNMP trap.

table.title: Local system monitoring alarms (NCC Fastpass mode- NokiaEnhancedSnmpSolutionSuiteAlarmIrp MIB)

entry.p: Other alarm parameters and behavioral characteristics
Target system is not in service.
Target system is in an overload state, <usage_state>. Affected components: [<components>].

entry.userinput: System in resource critical overload state

entry.p: Target system is in an overload state, resource critical. Components affected [<components>].
This alarm is raised when a diameter message validation error occurs.
This alarm is raised when a diameter SLF lookup failure occurs.
Throttling has been applied to Diameter messages.
Note: The component can be the SM or the ME in the AdditionalText. For example, for the ME component, the text will be “ME Component is Down”.
If NCC is running in Generic mode (NokiaEmsMib MIB is configured), this single alarm will be raised as two different alarms for each component. See for information about alarms when in Generic mode.
If NCC is running in Generic mode (NokiaEmsMib MIB is configured), this single alarm will be raised as different alarms for each service. See for information about alarms when in Generic mode.
Note: The service name in the AdditionalText can be one of:
If NCC is running in Generic mode (NokiaEmsMib MIB is configured), this single alarm will be raised as different alarms for each service. For information about alarms when in Generic mode, see .
Note: The service name in the AdditionalText can be one of:
Service <Service Name> is down on node <Host Id>.

entry.userinput: Service has less than N instances in service
entry.p: Note: The service name in the AdditionalText can be any of the following:
There are less than ${nFactor} (out of ${nFactor}+${kFactor}) ${serviceName} instances in service, which may jeopardize the ability to handle a full peak engineered load.
Traffic to node <Host Id> is disabled.

entry.userinput: SPS Site is Down Temporarily for an SU action

entry.p: SPS will automatically return to service shortly.

entry.userinput: A component of another SPS was determined to be Out Of Service
Diameter communication to another SPS is Down
SPS forced to treat component of another SPS site In Service, as if it had received an In Service heartbeat from the site.

entry.p: The tool force-remote-site-in-service was used to indicate that a component of the remote site should be treated as In Service, even though heartbeats are not being received.

entry.userinput: SPS automatically reset to normal heartbeat treatment for a component of another SPS

entry.p: The heartbeat service returned to normal operation, as communication has been reliable for the expected period of time.

entry.userinput: SPS returned to normal heartbeat treatment for a component of another SPS

entry.p: The tool force-remote-site-in-service was used to clear a component of another SPS that was previously forced In Service by the tool.
The DB monitor has detected that data migration is in progress in the local DB cluster

entry.userinput: Aerospike usable disk resources are low.

li.p: For minor or major severity: Aerospike has only <percentage> of usable disk resources. Aerospike defragmentation is unable to keep up with the current load.
For critical severity: Aerospike has only <percentage> of usable disk resources, which are critically low and may result in a stop-writes if the percentage drops below 5%.
For minor severity: Aerospike has only <percentage> of free memory, which is considered low.
For major severity: Aerospike has only <percentage> of free memory, which is considered very low.
For critical severity: Percentage of free memory capacity is critically low and may result in a stop-writes if the percentage drops below 10%.

entry.p: Until cause is reverted, Aerospike will reject all write-requests from other components in the system.

section.p: describes the alarms that are raised in generic mode. Generic mode means that the NokiaEmsMib MIB is configured.

note.p: If SPS is instantiated in Generic mode (NokiaEmsMib MIB is configured), the alarms with Alarm IDs 310404, 310405, 310406 are split into multiple alarms.

entry.p: Other alarm parameters and behavioral characteristics
Service LOADBALANCER is down on node <Host Id>.
Service AEROSPIKE_CLUSTER is down on node <Host Id>.
Service CDR is down on node <Host Id>.
Service CHARGING is down on node <Host Id>.
Service DIAMETERIO is down on node <Host Id>.
Service LTM is down on node <Host Id>.
Service NOTIFICATION is down on node <Host Id>.
Service POLICY is down on node <Host Id>.
Service PROVISIONING is down on node <Host Id>.
Service ROLLBACK is down on node <Host Id>.
Service SM is down on node <Host Id>.
Service TEM is down on node <Host Id>.
Service XDR is down on node <Host Id>.
Service KAFKA is down on node <Host Id>.
Service TRSCHEDULER is down on node <Host Id>.

section.title: Network monitoring alarms
section.p: The following table lists the network monitoring alarms.
section.note: AutoClear is described in the following tables as being "yes" or "no". AutoClear: yes means that the alarm will be cleared immediately after it is raised. AutoClear: no means that the alarm will be cleared once the condition or scenario has recovered from whatever caused the alarm.

The Alarm ID given for each alarm in all of these tables is displayed on NCC for all alarms. When the NokiaEmsMib MIB is used to integrate any NMS, the Alarm ID is not sent in the SNMP trap. However, when the NokiaEnhancedSnmpSolutionSuiteAlarmIrp MIB is used to integrate any NMS, the Alarm ID is sent in the SNMP trap.

entry.p: Other alarm parameters and behavioral characteristics
System has detected a peer connection for <RemoteOriginHost> using protocol <protocol>.
System has detected a peer disconnect for <RemoteOriginHost> using protocol <protocol>.
System has detected an SCTP address is available for <RemoteOriginHost>. IP address <ip address>.
System has detected an SCTP address is unavailable for <RemoteOriginHost>. IP address <ip address>.
Check contents of the countable event 'Failed Routing Attempts'.

entry.userinput: APP node unable to connect to remote peer, retry continues to fail

entry.p: APP node is unable to connect to <originHost> using protocol <protocol>. If the particular peer is connected with the ME in general, and the alarm does not clear by itself, Nokia recommends to RESTART the AppServer on this APP node, then CLEAR the alarm. If the alarm comes back, contact Nokia support.

entry.userinput: Heartbeat service on OAME not started.

entry.p: It is possible a subsystem was unavailable at startup. Restart the application server on the affected OAME.

entry.userinput: Heartbeat missing with member. Component for site still seen as in service.

entry.p: Heartbeat missing with member. At least one other member we received heartbeats from can see the component of the remote site as in service.

entry.userinput: Heartbeat missing with member. Treating the component for the remote site as OOS.

entry.p: All members reporting a heartbeat agree that the component for the remote site is unreachable or OOS. At least one of the reporters is from another location. Treating the component for the remote site as OOS.

entry.userinput: Heartbeat missing with member. No member from another location responded. Cannot declare component OOS.

entry.p: The remote site is unreachable or OOS. Only members at this location can be reached by heartbeat. The problem may be with the sites at this location. Treating the component for the remote site by its last known status.

entry.userinput: Heartbeat missing with member. Treating the site as OOS.(2 locations)

entry.p: The heartbeat between this site and the remote site is down. Treating the component for the remote site as OOS.

entry.userinput: Waiting for data to resynchronize from remote sites.

entry.p: The local site will remain OOS while waiting for data to resynchronize from remote sites.

entry.userinput: At least one node has detected CLUSTER_DOWN, CLUSTER_INACTIVE, or CLUSTER_WINDOW_SHIP for the remote site state.

entry.p: System has detected an connectivity state of ${dcState} for remote site '${remoteSite}'.

entry.userinput: The XDR timelag for the remote site exceeds the allowable threshold.

entry.p: The XDR timelag for remote site '${remoteSite}' is ${timelag} seconds.

entry.userinput: XDR. Override for OOS-WFR is enabled.

entry.p: XDR. Override for OOS-WFR is enabled.

entry.userinput: XDR. Override for OOS-DRR is enabled.

entry.p: XDR. Override for OOS-DRR is enabled.

entry.userinput: The Disaster Recovery procedure is required on these site(s) to re-synchronize their data with this SPS.

entry.p: The local site has determined that cross-data-replication is BEHIND or OVERFLOWED while transitioning from OOS to IS. The local site will remain OOS during disaster recovery.

entry.userinput: The local SPS site XDR is falling behind or has overflowed.

entry.p: The local site has determined that cross-data-replication is BEHIND or OVERFLOWED. The system has detected local SPS sync state is in a '${syncState}' state

entry.userinput: Digest Log size exceeded allowable threshold.

entry.p: XDR. Digest Log with size 30% has exceeded allowable threshold.

entry.userinput: Digest Log size exceeded allowable threshold.

entry.p: XDR. Digest Log with size 80% has exceeded allowable threshold.

entry.userinput: Digest Log size exceeded allowable threshold.

entry.p: XDR. The digest log with size 97% is overflowed, for one or more remote SPS site(s). Disaster Recovery procedure is required on these site(s) to re-sync their data with this SPS.

entry.userinput: Digest Log size exceeded allowable threshold.

entry.p: Digest Log with size 11% is now below allowable threshold.

entry.userinput: The destination errors for the remote site exceeds the allowable threshold.

entry.p: The XDR ship destination error count for remote site '${remoteSite}' is ${shipSourceErrorCount}.

entry.userinput: The source errors for the remote site exceeds the allowable threshold.

entry.p: The XDR ship source error count for remote site '${remoteSite}' is ${shipSourceErrorCount}.

entry.userinput: The ship latency average for the remote site exceeds the allowable threshold.

entry.p: The XDR ship latency average for remote site '${remoteSite}' is ${shipLatencyAverage}.

section.title: Other platform alarms
section.p: The following table lists security alarms, CDR alarms, threshold alarms, and the alarms raised for the ETCD cluster.
section.note: AutoClear is described in the following tables as being “yes” or “no”. AutoClear: yes means that the alarm will be cleared once the condition or scenario has recovered from whatever caused the alarm. AutoClear: no means that the alarm must be cleared manually.

The Alarm ID given for each alarm in all of these tables is displayed on NCC for all alarms. When the NokiaEmsMib MIB is used to integrate any NMS, the Alarm ID is not sent in the SNMP trap. However, when the NokiaEnhancedSnmpSolutionSuiteAlarmIrp MIB is used to integrate any NMS, the Alarm ID is sent in the SNMP trap.

entry.p: Other alarm parameters and behavioral characteristics
DB is unavailable. CALM will be out of service because the alarms is stored in DB. CALM have the retry logic. If this alarm is not clear for a long time, the administrator should handle this quickly.
Database health check failure with error message: <message string>

RabbitMQ is unavailable. CALM will not receive any alarms from RabbitMQ. CALM have the retry logic. If this alarm is not clear for a long time, the administrator should check the RabbitMQ connection and CALM configuration.
RabbitMQ health check failure with error message: <message string>

Kafka is unavailable. CALM will not receive any alarms from Kafka. CALM have the retry logic. If this alarm is not clear for a long time, the administrator should check the Kafka connection and CALM configuration.
Kafka health check failure with error message: <message string>

ETCD is unavailable. CALM will be out of service because the alarms is stored in ETCD. CALM have the retry logic. If this alarm is not clear for a long time, the administrator should handle this quickly.
ETCD health check failure with error code: <error code>, error message: <message string>

VES connection failure. CALM cannot send the VES event Message to VES. CALM have the retry logic. If this alarm is not clear for a long time, the administrator should check the VES connection and CALM configuration.
Cves agent health check failure with error: <error code>

row.entry: CALM Active Alarm Number Over Threshold

entry.p: Active Alarm Number is Over the Threshold. CALM have too many active alarms. The administor should check these alarms. Please clear some if necessary.
Database/ETCD table size is <current_alarm_table_size> over the <upper_limit_alarm_size>

CNOT connection failure. CALM cannot forward alarm notifications to CNOT. CALM has the retry logic. If this alarm is not cleared in a reasonable amount of time, the administrator should check the CNOT connection and CALM configuration.
CNOT health check failure with error message: <message string>
Indicates the keepalived component has experienced a failover. This alarm is triggered when the new Master transitions to ACTIVE.
NTP No response from external time service.
CHRONY No response from external time service.
It is a notification used to notify customer that ETCD doesn't work well. ETCD isn't available. Make sure ETCD is installed and configured correctly.
ETCD isn't available. Make sure ETCD is installed and configured correctly.
It is a notification used to notify customer that all of kafka brokers are down. Cannot connect to kafka brokers.
It is a notification used to notify customer to check CDR configurations in ETCD and the release ID sent to CDR.
Application specified pre-Rel10 CDR format but sent Rel10 or post-Rel10 CDR

It is a notification used to notify customer that CDR partition doesn't exist or isn't accessible. Failed to get CDR partition information. Make sure the partition (<cdr root directory>) exists and is accessible with CDR role.

It is a notification used to notify customer that the CDR disk usage is over the threshold and CDR stop receiving CDR traffic. Indicates the capacity of CDR disk partition has reached the max threshold.
It is a notification used to notify customer that CDR audit tool deleted some old CDR files to prevent file system from filling up.
High Filesystem usage detected. Filesystem usage is above 70%
High Filesystem usage detected. Filesystem usage is above 80%
High Filesystem usage detected. Filesystem usage is above 90%
High CPU usage detected. CPU usage is above 70%
High CPU usage detected. CPU usage is above 80%
High CPU usage detected. CPU usage is above 90%
High swap space usage detected. Swap space usage is above 70%
High swap space usage detected. Swap space usage is above 80%
High swap space usage detected. Swap space usage is above 90%
High memory usage detected. Memory usage is above 85%
High memory usage detected. Memory usage is above 93%
High memory usage detected. Memory usage is above 95%
Too many zombie processes detected. Zombie process count is above 5
Too many zombie processes detected. Zombie process count is above 10
Too many zombie processes detected. Zombie process count is above 15
The number of re-trans segments is more than threshold. The number of re-trans segments is more than 1500000
CPRO: prometheus-server- Usage of memory is greater than the threshold value
Error occured after restarting Prometheus Service as procedure to cleanup memory
1. Check prometheus service status using "systemctl status prometheus-server"
3. If there is WAL corruption or segment corruption error follow below procedure
a. Delete offending file reported in logs and restart prometheus service using "systemctl restart prometheus-server"
b. Delete all directories from /appdata/cpro/prometheus/ directory except /appdata/cpro/prometheus/meas directory
c. Restart prometheus service using "systemctl restart prometheus-server"

row.entry: User account dormant threshold warning - no action taken

entry.p: A user account has been dormant for an extended time period defined by the WARN_IDLE_LOGINS parameter.

row.entry: User account dormant threshold exceeded - account locked

entry.p: A user account has been dormant for an extended time period defined by the WARN_IDLE_LOGINS parameter.

row.entry: Excessive authentication failures - user account access disabled

entry.p: A user account 'log-in' access is being disabled because the MAX_LOGIN_FAILURES threshold was crossed.
A user account 'log-in' access is being disabled because the MAX_LOGIN_FAILURES threshold was crossed.
An entry in the node's routing table has been added or removed.
service:rtmon,status:started || service:rtmon,status:stopped || user:%s,service:rtmon,detail:User has attempted to modify IP routing table"

row.entry: User has attempted to modify log

entry.p: An unauthorized user attempted to modify a security log. This is associated with the default set of audits (specifically those with the log keyword) and is always enabled.

row.entry: User has attempted to modify log

entry.p: An unauthorized user attempted to modify a security log. This is associated with the default set of audits (specifically those with the log keyword) and is always enabled.

entry.userinput: User Account File has been modified by user

entry.p: User or group information files such as group, password or shadow have been opened (associated with the access set of audits and can be enabled at discretion of admin). This alarm is also generated when the config audit key is triggered. Several of these are specified in the default set of audits.
The time or date has been changed (associated with the time-change set of audits and can be enabled at discretion of admin).

row.entry: User has attempted to access nonpermissible file

entry.p: User account files have been modified (associated with the identity set of audits and can be enabled at discretion of admin).

row.entry: User has attempted to modify root crontab

entry.p: The root user cron table has been modified.

row.entry: Security audit logging enabled and started

entry.p: The watson account logging has been enabled and started.

row.entry: Security audit logging stopped and disabled

entry.p: The watson account logging has been stopped and disabled.
An admin has invoked the AuditMgr tool to enable (start) a configured set of audits.
An admin has invoked the AuditMgr tool to disable (stop) a configured set of audits.

entry.userinput: Possible Denial of Service Attack Detected

entry.p: The iptables rule(s) have crossed packet-drop threshold.

Full Reset - restarting iptables packet count tracking || Rule%s Reset - restarting iptables packet count tracking || Rule%s crossed over threshold of %d packets over %d seconds || Rule%s crossed under threshold of %d packets over %d seconds
Generated when file system has crossed minor alarm threshold.
AutoClear: yes (but it is auto-cleared once the condition has recovered)
Generated when file system has crossed minor alarm threshold.
AutoClear: yes (but it is auto-cleared once the condition has recovered)
Generated when file system has crossed minor alarm threshold.
AutoClear: yes (but it is auto-cleared once the condition has recovered)
Failed to resolve remote data center MaxScale service.
Failed to resolve remote data center Master service.
Inter data center replication lag has exceeded threshold.
Access to leader-elector container has failed via
Remote data center MaxScale access has failed.
Remote data center MaxScale shows no Master available.
Database has gone down and keycloak lost the connectivity.
